channel.title: Orba Artiphon Connect to Axoloti
channel.description:
Hello this is my first post on this forum. I like the Axoloti very much. I use existing user patches (thanks!!) to get accustomed and to try to understand and or simply enjoy the great variety of sounds.
Attracted by the Orba Artiphon to use it as a midi controller for the Axoloti I bought one! I was especially interested in the simple design and the gestures possibilities and midi options to use it as a mini keyboard e.g.
But i am not sure how to implement the MIDI connections. IN this case the Axoloti will be the host and the Orba the controller via USB. Axoloti recognizes the Orba, but it states "Mid class fail to init"
In fact, this is the complete message: USB Device Attached PID: 5740h VID: 0h Address (#1) assigned. cfg desc: num interfaces 6 interface: interface 0, num 0, numep 0, class 1 , sub class 1 interface: interface 1, num 1, numep 0, class 1 , sub class 2 interface: interface 2, num 1, numep 2, class 1 , sub class 2 endpoint: interface 2, ep num 0, addr 3 endpoint: interface 2, ep num 1, addr 83 interface: interface 3, num 2, numep 1, class 2 , sub class 2 endpoint: interface 3, ep num 0, addr 82 interface: interface 4, num 3, numep 2, class A , sub class 0 endpoint: interface 4, ep num 0, addr 1 endpoint: interface 4, ep num 1, addr 81 interface: interface 5, num 4, numep 0, class 1 , sub class 1 Manufacturer : Artiphon Product : Artiphon Orba Serial Number : 357E34773039 Enumeration done. Default configuration set. MID class failed to init
Is there anybody who can help me out pls? Appreciate it. Peter vD

item.title: Orba Artiphon Connect to Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @monjet peter van doornum
item.description:
@monjet wrote:

Yes I tried and it works well with Synth One on IPhone over Bluetooth without any adjustments. Still wondering why itâ€™s is not working with Axoloti, because it seems tot be class compliant. Grtz Peter

Read full topic

item.title: Orba Artiphon Connect to Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @monjet peter van doornum
item.description:
@monjet wrote:

Not yet but I will try

Read full topic

item.title: Orba Artiphon Connect to Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @tele_player
item.description:
@tele_player wrote:

Have you tried to use it as a USB MIDI controller on a computer?

Read full topic

item.title: Orba Artiphon Connect to Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @monjet peter van doornum
item.description:
@monjet wrote:

I just switched MIDI modes 1. MPE 2. Single Channel and 3. Channel per Part on the Orba and there is no difference in in Numeration whatsoever sadly

Read full topic

item.title: Orba Artiphon Connect to Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @tele_player
item.description:
@tele_player wrote:

When you switch MIDI modes on Orba, then plug it into the Axoloti Host port, do you see any difference in the USB enumeration, specifically, Class and Subclass?

Does the Orba work for you as a controller in other applications?

Read full topic

item.title: Orba Artiphon Connect to Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @monjet peter van doornum
item.description:
@monjet wrote:

Yes it is the latest firmware

Read full topic

item.title: Orba Artiphon Connect to Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @tele_player
item.description:
@tele_player wrote:

Did you update the Orba firmware to the newest version?

Read full topic

item.title: Orba Artiphon Connect to Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @monjet peter van doornum
item.description:
@monjet wrote:

Hi tele_player

I tried indeed to alter these settings, but it did not work out. Maybe it works if I switch the Orba on/off after the change of settings! So far thank you for the advice

Read full topic

item.title: Orba Artiphon Connect to Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @tele_player
item.description:
@tele_player wrote:

Or maybe not. Things to try:
- update Orba firmware.
- setting the Orba MIDI mode to single channel, or channel-per-part, assuming itâ€™s set to MPE.

Read full topic

item.title: Orba Artiphon Connect to Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @tele_player
item.description:
@tele_player wrote:

Yes, I think it is incompatible at this time. An Axoloti firmware update might be required, but there have been no updates to the stable Axoloti release in years.

Read full topic

item.title: Orba Artiphon Connect to Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @monjet peter van doornum
item.description:
@monjet wrote:

Does that mean the Orba is not compatible?

Read full topic

item.title: Orba Artiphon Connect to Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @tele_player
item.description:
@tele_player wrote:

Axoloti recognizes the Orba, but Axoloti is looking for an interface with Class=1 (audio) and Subclass=3 (midistreaming).

Read full topic

item.title: Orba Artiphon Connect to Axoloti
item.dc:creator: @monjet peter van doornum
item.description:
@monjet wrote:

Hello this is my first post on this forum. I like the Axoloti very much. I use existing user patches (thanks!!) to get accustomed and to try to understand and or simply enjoy the great variety of sounds.

Attracted by the Orba Artiphon to use it as a midi controller for the Axoloti I bought one! I was especially interested in the simple design and the gestures possibilities and midi options to use it as a mini keyboard e.g.

But i am not sure how to implement the MIDI connections. IN this case the Axoloti will be the host and the Orba the controller via USB. Axoloti recognizes the Orba, but it states "Mid class fail to init"

In fact, this is the complete message:
USB Device Attached
PID: 5740h
VID: 0h
Address (#1) assigned.
cfg desc: num interfaces 6
interface: interface 0, num 0, numep 0, class 1 , sub class 1
interface: interface 1, num 1, numep 0, class 1 , sub class 2
interface: interface 2, num 1, numep 2, class 1 , sub class 2
endpoint: interface 2, ep num 0, addr 3
endpoint: interface 2, ep num 1, addr 83
interface: interface 3, num 2, numep 1, class 2 , sub class 2
endpoint: interface 3, ep num 0, addr 82
interface: interface 4, num 3, numep 2, class A , sub class 0
endpoint: interface 4, ep num 0, addr 1
endpoint: interface 4, ep num 1, addr 81
interface: interface 5, num 4, numep 0, class 1 , sub class 1
Manufacturer : Artiphon
Product : Artiphon Orba
Serial Number : 357E34773039
Enumeration done.
Default configuration set.
MID class failed to init

Is there anybody who can help me out pls?
Appreciate it. Peter vD

Read full topic
